doodlejump.gui

Class Highscore

  • java.lang.Object
    • doodlejump.gui.Highscore

  • public class Highscore
extends java.lang.Object
    Instance of the Highscore game state. Manages Highscores. Reads and Writes Highscores to a text file.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Highscore()
      Constructor sets up a new Highscore screen with the given image.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addScoreToTopTen(int playerscore, java.lang.String playername)
      Method adds the player and his score to the list and writes it to the high scores file.
      boolean isScoreInTopTen(int playerscore)
      Method that tells whether the player made it to the high score list
      void piirra(java.awt.Graphics graphics)
      Draws the High score image and all the names and high scores on the screen.
      void readFile()
      Reads the text file that contains the save high scores.
      void writeToFile()
      Writes to the text file that contains the high scores.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Highscore

        public Highscore()
        Constructor sets up a new Highscore screen with the given image. Names-variable contain the high scorers names in a List Scores-variable contains the high scores in a list

        Writes to the text file that contains the high scores.

      • isScoreInTopTen

        public boolean isScoreInTopTen(int playerscore)
        Method that tells whether the player made it to the high score list
        Parameters:
        playerscore - is the score of the player in the latest game.
        Returns:
        a boolean that shows whether the player made it to the high score list

      • addScoreToTopTen

        public void addScoreToTopTen(int playerscore,
                    java.lang.String playername)
        Method adds the player and his score to the list and writes it to the high scores file.
        Parameters:
        playerscore - score of the player to add to the list
        playername - name of the player to add to the list
